definition: to hoodwink/to deceive/to dupe sb
blind/dim-sighted
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: The mild Mr. Tyson was completely foxed by his wife.
sentences.chinese: 溫厚的泰森先生被他妻子徹底矇騙了。

sentences.english: He took the girl in with his story.
sentences.chinese: 他用一套謊言矇騙了那個女孩。

sentences.english: Don't let yourself be taken in by such absurd deception.
sentences.chinese: 你不要被這些歪理邪說矇騙了。

sentences.english: The problem is that the brain tricks the person.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題是在於大腦矇騙了當事者。

sentences.english: The muddle-headed manager is often put over by his employees.
sentences.chinese: 那個頭腦糊塗的經理總是受僱員的矇騙。

sentences.english: She is accused of attempting to cheat the taxman .
sentences.chinese: 她被指控企圖矇騙稅務員。

sentences.english: So don't be fooled by that single tear drop.
sentences.chinese: 所以別被那滴眼淚給矇騙了哦。

sentences.english: People get savvy as they get older, but a lot of people are blindsided by it.
sentences.chinese: 他們變老時人變得精明，但很多人都被矇騙了。

sentences.english: When dreams of your presence my slumbers beguile.
sentences.chinese: 我在睡夢中被你的幻影矇騙。

sentences.english: The hacking group also accused the companies of mistreating their customers.
sentences.chinese: 另外，這個黑客團體還指責AT&T公司矇騙用戶。

sentences.english: Nerver judge a book by it's cover , as it can fool you.
sentences.chinese: 不要從封面來判斷一本書的好壞，因爲封面會矇騙你。

sentences.english: He tried to blind unsophisticated young girls with his handsome appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖通過自己俊朗的外型來矇騙單純的少女。

sentences.english: However, they may cheat more people to attend the contests by changing their banner.
sentences.chinese: 改旗易幟，或許會多矇騙幾個人前來捧場。

sentences.english: Do not be deceived by my peaceful face.
sentences.chinese: 不要被我平靜的外表所矇騙。

sentences.english: I will no longer be fooled by the garments who wea for mine eyes are open.
sentences.chinese: 我不再被他們的外表所矇騙，我已睜開雙眼。

definition: to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
Heaven knows!
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: to sign/to make one's mark
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to play deaf-mute
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to exaggerate
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
switchboard operator
sequel/continuation of a book
